content.raw: If it is not passed explicitly as a cpp option, then it is read from the segway.inc file. Each task writes to a different segway.inc file, one in traindir/auxiliary/ and one in identifydir/auxiliary/, but as Michael said in a recent email, "identifydir/auxiliary/segway.inc may not actually be used here. The other files used (specified by train.tab) may specify the #include relative to their own location (traindir) not identifydir." In my last meeting with Michael, he said that this isn't a problem in general because identify is supposed to use the same parameters as the train task, but the train task will have the non-default CARD_SUPERVISIONLABEL variable if run in semi-supervised mode, which will break the identify task if the cpp option is not explicitly passed to the gmtk commands.
content.html: If it is not passed explicitly as a cpp option, then it is read from the segway.inc file. Each task writes to a different segway.inc file, one in traindir/auxiliary/ and one in identifydir/auxiliary/, but as Michael said in a recent email, "identifydir/auxiliary/segway.inc may not actually be used here. The other files used (specified by train.tab) may specify the #include relative to their own location (traindir) not identifydir." In my last meeting with Michael, he said that this isn't a problem in general because identify is supposed to use the same parameters as the train task, but the train task will have the non-default CARD_SUPERVISIONLABEL variable if run in semi-supervised mode, which will break the identify task if the cpp option is not explicitly passed to the gmtk commands.
